basics.name: Jonathan Lys
basics.summary: First year PhD student at IMT Atlantique. Previously research intern in the Criteo AI Lab. Computer Vision, Natural Language Processing and Deep Learning enthusiast. I like to optimize the training and the generation of large language models and diffusion models.

education.description:
Focusing on discrete diffusion models and NLP applications.
Supervised by Vincent Gripon, Bastien Pasdeloup, Axel Marmoret.

Double degree program with Rennes 1 and CentraleSupélec.
Signal and Image processing major.

work.summary: Two visits to EUREC, total of 3 months.
highlights: Worked on conditional generation for text diffusion models.
Studied looped AR LLMs for reasoning tasks.

work.summary:
Studied diffusion models, for image background generation.
Supervised by Jaspreet Sandhu, Thibaut Issenhuth, Ludovic Dos Santos
highlights: Trained large-scale diffusion models up to 6B parameters.
Developed an ad background generation pipeline, reducing object extension by 10×, achieving lowest FID and fast inference.
Worked on billions of product images, leveraging PySpark and distributed training.

work.company: IMT Atlantique, BRAIN Team, Brest, France
work.summary: Studied parameter-efficient fine-tuning methods for SAM and attention-based data augmentation techniques. Supervised by Bastien Pasdeloup.
highlights: Matched the performance of full fine-tuning with a custom LoRA method.
Improved the performance of CNNs through attention-based data augmentation.

work.company: French Polynesia’s government IT Department, Papeete, French Polynesia
work.summary: Development of a Web application for network management, automation of database migrations
